diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,28 @@
+#pragma once
+
+#include <functional>
+#include <iostream>
+
+namespace c10 {
+
+enum class DeviceId : uint8_t {
+    UNDEFINED,
body:
You're not supposed to ever do `static_cast<int>(DeviceId)`. Semantically, these enum members don't have an int value assigned to them.

If serialization logic needs to cast these from/to int, then that's the responsibility of the serialization logic and they define functions to map this enum from/to int (or, maybe a better choice, from/to string)

body_text:
You're not supposed to ever do static_cast<int>(DeviceId). Semantically, these enum members don't have an int value assigned to them.
If serialization logic needs to cast these from/to int, then that's the responsibility of the serialization logic and they define functions to map this enum from/to int (or, maybe a better choice, from/to string)
